communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All records in digital audio format  of all broadcasts made by the Westchester County Real-Time Crime Center, a unit within the  Westchester County Department of Public Safety/Police Department,  using the software platform "Zello" or any other product created by Zello INC. of whose Headquarters is Austin, Texas between May 1st, 2023 and October 1st, 2023.

2)All records of Invoices, Purchase orders, Payments, and Contracts made between the Westchester County Department of Public Safety/Police Department and Zello Inc. whose headquarters is in Austin, Texas or any of it's affiliates for the use of their services generated between 2013 and 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Smith

title: Ventilation, filtration, and liability, redo pt 1

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ventilation, filtration, and liability, redo pt 1
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any non-exempt records dated between December 1, 2019 and December 1, 2022 created or naming the following individuals:
Dr. Anthony S Fauci (Director)
Dr. Cristina Cassetti (Deputy director, div microbiology and infectious diseases)
Roshawn Treadwell-Hyde (Dr. Cassetti's assistant)
Lerner, Andrea Office of Clinical Research Resources
Dr. Seema Nayak, Director, Office of Clinical Research Resources
Melinda Haskins, Chief, Office of Communications and Government Relations
Courtney Billet, Director, Office of Communications and Government Relations
Cynthia Fabry, Deputy, Director Office of Communications and Government Relations


....for records that contain the terms "filter", "filters", "air filtration", "air filter", "air filters", "purification", "purifier ", "purifiers ", "air purifier", "MERV", "liability", "liable", "legal", "CO2", "carbon dioxide", "indoor air", "shared air", "airborne", "airborne transmission", "aerosolized droplets", "droplet nuclei", "ultrafine droplets", "entrained droplets", "beyond 6 feet", "beyond 6ft", "beyond 2m", "transmission via infectious aerosols".

This is a resubmission of 60878, but with only 8 individuals and slightly fewer search terms. Please inform me if that is insufficiently narrow.

I apologize for the waste of your time with the earlier  broad request. It is hard for an outsider to know a priori which individuals might be most relevant, and how many records each individual person or term may return a priori - so I often cast a very broad net to begin with.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ALEXANDER RICCIO

communications.subject: Immediate Action Required: NIH FOIA Request 60900
communications.communication:
October 26, 2023 

Hello Mr. Riccio: 

Thank you for your resubmission. Unfortunately, your new FOIA request, 60900, does not address both searches and their search terms from you previously combined and closed cases, 60877 and 60878. 

Below, I've listed both sets of search terms from each case. Please review sets of search terms and narrow down the search terms to terms that are not broad to eliminate email results that are voluminous, both 
Please provide a response by Thursday, November 2, 2023 to qianna.norman@nih.gov. 

Thank you. 
Set One: 

"n95", "p95", "n100", "p100", "respirator", "elastomeric", "OSHA", "Occupational hazard", "workplace safety", "workplace hazard", "worker safety", "workers compensation", "negligence", "precaution", "precautionary", "precautionary principle", "worker protections", "airborne hazard", "respiratory hazard", "air sanitation", "respiratory protection program", "costly regulations", "costly regulatory requirements", "occupational safety", "engineering controls", "hierarchy of controls", "undue burden", "onerous", "burdensome". 
Set Two: 
"filter", "filters", "air filtration", "air filter", "air filters", "purification", "purifier ", "purifiers ", "air purifier", "MERV", "liability", "liable", "legal", "CO2", "carbon dioxide", "indoor air", "air quality", "shared air", "airborne", "airborne transmission", "aerosolized droplets", "droplet nuclei", "ultrafine droplets", "entertained droplets", 
"beyond 6 feet", "beyond 6'", "beyond 6ft", "beyond 2m", "transmission via infectious aerosols", "cover their butts", "air in a room", "air inside a room", and "respiratory droplets in the air". 
V/r, 
Qianna Norman, M.A. (she/her/hers) 
Government Information Specialist 
Freedom of Information and Privacy Act Branch/FOIA Service Center

title: Alex James Widdicombe Traffic Incident Report (Greenville County Sheriff's Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all service and incident-level data relating to a traffic incident in which a pedestrian, Alex James Widdicombe, was struck by a vehicle in the city of Greenville on or about the night of March 2nd, 2019.

In order to help to determine my status for purposes of determining the applicability of any fees, you should know that I am the brother of the above mentioned pedestrian, Alex James Widdicombe, and am seeking this information purely for my own clarity regarding ongoing concerns over his mental health. To be clear, I am seeking this information for personal use and not for a commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Widdicombe

title: Request for ZEEVIC Work Group Meeting Records

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for ZEEVIC Work Group Meeting Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking access to records related to the Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council (ZEEVIC) Work Group meetings held since July 1, 2023. These records include agendas, lists of attendees, and meeting notes as well as any other related records. I am interested in records from both the ZEV Policy Scorecard Work Group and the Trucking MHDV Infrastructure Work Group meetings, as well as any other ZEEVIC Work Group meetings that have been held. I am also seeking any records announcing the Work Group meetings as well as any communications inviting attendees or potential attendees. 

If all or any part of this request is denied, I request that I be provided with a written explanation that includes the reason for the denial, the legal authority justifying the denial, and my appeal rights. If you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the portions that can be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Jaheim Pugh 911 Calls
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am a producer with a documentary television series for SundanceTV and I am reaching out to put in a public record request for any and all 911 calls made in the early morning hours on December 13, 2020 related to the shooting that took place at 901 Rosedale Avenue in Prichard and resulted in the death of Jaheim Pugh (aka Bella Pugh) and the injuries to two other people.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Rob Vernier.

communications.subject: RE: [BULK] Alabama Open Records Law Request: Jaheim Pugh 911 Calls
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

I received your request for records and unfortunately without a subpoena I can not release any recordings unless the person who made the phone call is making the request. We follow the Alabama State 911 Board’s policy regarding releasing recordings. Below you will find the link to their website stating the policy.

https://www.al911board.com/resources/9-1-1-recordings

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thanks,

Jordan D. Morris  •  Records Custodian


Mobile County Communications District 9-1-1 Center
AORL Office
7340 Zeigler Boulevard
Mobile, AL 36608

October 26, 2023

title: Missouri Drug Free Zone Sentence Information (Department of Corrections)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all records related to persons serving drug free zone law sentence enhancements– as mentioned in Missouri Revised Statutes 579.030, 579.055, 579.065.3(11)  – in the state of Missouri on the state and local levels. These records should, if available, state names, date of conviction, inmate ID and parole eligibility date and any demographic data that has been collected.  I am specifically looking for records from 2015 to the date that this request is processed.

In addition, I am requesting a copy of any and all reports or studies generated by the state that discuss the passage and efficacy of the drug free zone law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Nuisance Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (October 2021-October 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Chronic Nuisance Properties" as described in Section 16-22 of Providence's city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance

•  Notice to Vacate's filed by property owners as a result of nuisance abatement 

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance 

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

title: Nuisance Ordinance Information Request (Homestead Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (October 2021-October 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Resident Managers" as described in Article VI Sec. 19-105 through Sec. 19-107 in Homestead's city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance

•  Notice to Vacate's filed by property owners as a result of nuisance abatement 

• Monthly meeting notes including, as per the code: " (i) a list of all current tenants, (ii) a list of tenant evictions, either in process and the status thereof, or completed during the past month which resulted from criminal activity, (iii) an explanation of the resolution or pending resolution of any tenant or management originated police call prompted by criminal activity and (iv) any other information which would tend to decrease and/or eliminate criminal activity in the apartment complexes."

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fboynton-beach-police-department-18724%252Fnuisance-ordinance-information-request-153676%252F%253Femail%253Dcityclerk%252540bbfl.us&url_auth_token=AABlEUgRB54Od6NQpFr2HA_iI0w%3A1qvptI%3Av2HGxjmKNDRe7j0I4V1TQlbAqZvb9ttBmIPZymFisDc 
Per Florida State Statute 316.066(2)(a)(b) all Crash reports that reveal the identity and/or personal information concerning the parties involved in the crash are confidential for the first 60 days and only immediately available to the parties involved in the crash, their legal representatives, their licensed insurance agents. An involved party listed in the crash report may obtain a copy in person at the Police Records Department located at 2100 High Ridge Road, Boynton Beach, FL 33426, Monday through Friday (excluding holidays) from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM and must present a valid driver’s license or other photographic identification. 
FSS Florida State Statue 316.066(2)(d) states the Involved parties legal representatives must present a valid driver’s license or other photographic identification; proof of status, or identification that demonstrate his or her qualifications to access that information, and file a written sworn statement with the state or local agency in possession of the information stating that information from a crash report made confidential and exempt by this section will not be used for any commercial or accident victims, or knowingly disclosed to any third party for the purpose of such solicitation. 
****This subsection does not prevent the dissemination or publication of news to the general public by any legitimate media entitled to access confidential and exempt information pursuant to this section. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant Police staff to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Florida Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
 
Thank You, 
 
City of Boynton Beach, FL

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Bomb threat
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

On Tuesday October 24, Oregon State University officials warned the public not to open any food delivery robots because of a bomb threat.

University officials at the Corvallis, Oregon, campus at lunchtime sent out what they called an urgent alert on X, formerly known as Twitter, that there was a bomb threat in Starship food delivery robots.

I am looking for any emails, memos, or investigatory documents regarding this incident. Please Include email attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MO DPS Private Contractors
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list of private-sector security or investigation firms, companies, organizations, corporations, collaboratives or other entities contracting with Missouri Department of Public Safety to provide reporting of surveillance, security, intelligence or investigation for the purpose of public safety. 

I request that in conducting searches for releasable records, that you please disclose records even if they are currently available publicly through (your agency portal) other sources outside of your agency, such as the Missouri Accountability Portal or the National Archives and Records Administration

As the records sought detail the operations and activities of our government, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use. 

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. However, as I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functioning, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.  

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or USB thumb drive if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

The Missouri Department of Public Safety, Office of the Director (“DPS”) received your records request made pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law on October 24, 2023. DPS provides the following response only its own behalf. This response is being submitted within the three-day period required by the Missouri Sunshine Law. § 610.023.3, RSMo.

You requested the following records: “A list of private-sector security or investigation firms, companies, organizations, corporations, collaborative or other entities contracting with Missouri Department of Public Safety to provide reporting of surveillance, security, intelligence or investigation for the purpose of public safety.” DPS does not have any documents responsive to this request. This concludes this request.

title: University of Vermont - Cancellation of Mohammed El-Kurd event

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: University of Vermont - Cancellation of Mohammed El-Kurd event
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any incident report or similar record by UVM Police Services concerning the Miller Lecture Series event, originally planned for October 26, 2023, involving Mohammed El-Kurd.

2. Any correspondence sent to or from any of the following officials or offices (including any person employed by the office) between October 1, 2023 and October 22, 2023 which relates to the October 26 event or mentions any of the identified terms:
a. "Officials or offices" include: Division of Safety and Compliance, UVM Police Services, Adam White, or the Office of the President
b. "Terms" include: "Miller Lecture", "Mohammed", "El-Kurd"

3. Any records reflecting or substantiating the "conversations over the past week with community members, campus partners and public safety officials" referenced by UVM's statement to VT Digger, reported here:  https://vtdigger.org/2023/10/23/citing-safety-concerns-university-of-vermont-cancels-event-with-palestinian-writer.

4. Any records reflecting or substantiating the university's "assessment [...] that holding the event on campus this week raises safety and security concerns that cannot be sufficiently mitigated."

5. The incident reports for the following UVM Police Services reports: 23UV007799, 23UV007820, 23UV007913, 23UV007969.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
